question: 自動詞
sourceMnemonic: An <kanji>automatic</kanji> <kanji>part of speech</kanji> is an <vocabulary>intransitive verb</vocabulary>. Intransitive verbs are actions that just happen, aka you're not the one doing the action or thing. These are words like <ja>付く</ja> or <ja>消える</ja>, where you aren't doing the action. That's why they're automatic!
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well.
